categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Technical Discussions (January 6-7, 2026)

content.text:
## Discord Plugin Issues and Fixes

A user (DigitalDiva) encountered persistent issues with the Discord plugin not detecting server IDs, usernames, or server ownership despite proper configuration. The error "No server ID found 10" was traced to version compatibility issues between ElizaOS 1.7.0 and plugin-discord 1.3.3. Odilitime identified the problem as a transition from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in the codebase and created a fix branch (odi-17) to address bootstrap actions/providers issues. A PR (#6333) was submitted to fix plugin-bootstrap for version 1.7.0, though additional work was needed for full Discord plugin compatibility. The team recommended users either downgrade to core version 1.6.5 or wait for the updated release.

## New Contributor Onboarding

A blockchain and AI engineer (aicodeflow.dev) joined the community expressing interest in contributing to ElizaOS, particularly around agent autonomy with constraints, onchain execution layers with guardrails, prediction markets/event-driven systems, and observability tooling. Odilitime welcomed them and suggested starting by reading the code and working on existing plugins, pointing to github.com/elizaos-plugins/ as a resource. The lead developer of the Spartan project (https://github.com/elizaos/spartan) offered to connect and discuss DeFi utilities. K_carv recommended connecting with Odilitime and mentioned upcoming open sessions for collaboration.

## Database Migration Issues

A developer encountered destructive migration errors when running `elizaos start` a second time, with the system blocking changes that would drop columns. The solution provided was to either set `ELIZA_ALLOW_DESTRUCTIVE_MIGRATIONS=true` for local development or use the `elizaos dev` command for continuous monitoring during development. This is safe for local environments but requires careful review for production deployments.

## Contract Address Visibility Discussion

Community members raised concerns about the difficulty of finding official ElizaOS contract addresses (CA) on X/Twitter accounts. Shaw acknowledged the issue and committed to posting the CA across official accounts. The team discussed best practices, with some suggesting pinned tweets while others noted that top projects typically link to websites where token info is one click away. K_carv mentioned that the Linktree is being refreshed to point to CoinGecko for easier access to contract information.

## Core Development Updates

The core development team worked on several technical improvements:

- Odilitime created PR #6333 to fix plugin-bootstrap and SQL minor actions/providers for serverId issues in version 1.7.0
- Stan submitted PRs for unified messaging API implementation in both Telegram (#22) and Discord (#41) plugins
- Stan prepared an RFC document on Hybrid Architecture with Persistent Workers for team review
- Discussion of cloud architecture improvements, including handling TOCTOU race conditions and runtime initialization optimizations
- Exploration of gateway architecture for different connectors, with considerations for scaling event pumps and preprocessing
- Jin shared the team's HackMD workspace at https://hackmd.io/@elizaos/book

## Technical Resources and Tools

Several technical resources were shared:

- GitHub Agentics workflow documentation for updating docs: https://github.com/githubnext/agentics/blob/main/workflows/update-docs.md
- X402 protocol integration library for ElizaOS: npm i @alleyboss/micropay-solana-x402-paywall
- Zoey framework mentioned as a Rust-inspired alternative to ElizaOS (https://zoey.xyz/)
- Discussion of Cursor AI optimization, noting that using your own Claude API key doesn't provide Cursor's optimized version
- ElizaOS cloud API endpoint usage guidance: use provider prefix format like "openai/gpt-4o-mini" or "anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5"

## Migration and Token Questions

Users asked about AI16Z to ElizaOS migration mechanics, with clarification provided that only tokens held at the November 11 snapshot are eligible for migration at a 1:6 ratio. Questions about token utility in the new version were raised but not fully addressed in the captured conversations.

## Community Engagement

HackMD reached out expressing support for ElizaOS builders using their platform. Various community members shared memes and casual conversation, maintaining an active and engaged development community atmosphere.

Issue #6332 reports a performance problem where Turbo build is consuming excessive memory, reaching 21GB or more. This memory consumption issue was reported by madjin and could impact build performance and system resources.

Issue #6331 describes a bug where a "Model not found" error occurs when using agent ID with API endpoints. This issue was also reported by madjin and appears to be affecting API functionality when attempting to reference models by agent ID.

During the period from January 6 to January 7, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository showed minimal development activity. There were no new pull requests created or merged during this timeframe. However, the repository did see 2 new issues opened, with 2 contributors actively participating in the project during these two days.
sources: From 2026-01-06 to 2026-01-07, elizaos/eliza had 0 new PRs (0 merged), 2 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

content.text: This topic focuses on the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project. However, the provided source does not contain specific information about who the contributors are, their contribution statistics, or details about their involvement in the project. To provide accurate information about the top contributors, additional data such as commit counts, pull requests, code reviews, or other contribution metrics would be needed.
